artist: Hashiguchi Goyō; Producer: Posthumously produced by Hashiguchi Yasuo
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
medium: Woodblock print, ink and color on paper
signed: 五葉画 {Goyō ga} (picture by Goyō) | 大正九年八月 {Taishō kunen hachigatsu} (August 1920)
text: Artwork dated to August 1920 but first posthumously printed in 1953. A woman has begun to undress so she can clean herself before entering the bathtub in which her mirror image is visible.
title: Woman at a Hot Spring
